Title: reinterpretAsInt8
Description: Performs byte reinterpretation by treating the input value as a value of type Int8. Unlike CAST, the function does not attempt to preserve the original value - if the target type is not able to represent the input type, the output is meaningless.
x: value to byte reinterpret as Int8. (U)Int*, Float, Date, DateTime, UUID, String or FixedString.
Reinterpreted value x as Int8. Int8.
Examples: SELECT    toUInt8(257) AS x,    toTypeName(x),    reinterpretAsInt8(x) AS res,    toTypeName(res);
